notes: proper noun, city name; article often omitted
proper noun; indefinite article used rarely in special contexts
definite article; often omitted before city names
example_sentence_italian: La napoli che conosco è rumorosa.
example_sentence_english: The Naples I know is noisy.

notes: plural identical to singular; plural use is rare
example_sentence_italian: Napoli sono celebrate in molte canzoni.
example_sentence_english: Naples are celebrated in many songs.

example_sentence_italian: Le napoli antiche non esistono più.
example_sentence_english: The old Naples do not exist anymore.

notes: partitive plural form; used metaphorically or poetically

example_sentence_italian: Il centro della napoli è affollato.
example_sentence_english: The center of Naples is crowded.

notes: contraction of a + la; standard form is often simply 'a Napoli'
example_sentence_english: I am going to Naples tomorrow.

notes: contraction of a + le; plural form uncommon
example_sentence_italian: Arriviamo alle napoli per le feste.
example_sentence_english: We arrive at the Napless for the festivals.

notes: contraction of da + le; plural use rare
example_sentence_english: I returned from the Napless I visited.

notes: contraction of in + le; plural form uncommon
example_sentence_english: In the old Napless there were walls.

example_sentence_italian: Ho letto un articolo sulla napoli.
example_sentence_english: I read an article about Naples.

notes: contraction of su + le; plural form uncommon
example_sentence_english: I have information about the historic Napless.

notes: con + la is not contracted; used in formal contexts
example_sentence_italian: Collaboro con la napoli per un evento.
example_sentence_english: I collaborate with Naples for an event.

notes: con + le is not contracted; plural form rare
example_sentence_english: We work with the twin Napless.
